p: Additional common principles that can be adapted to enable transparent and robust assessments of climate risk include: ‘open secrets’ frameworks18 which have proven to be a useful way to share information between private and public organisations without foregoing the commercial value of such datasets; and open-access, peer-reviewed publications—provided that sufficient information on methods, metadata, data and software is made available—which can facilitate knowledge diffusion and local capacity building, contributing to the creation of organisational memory and increasing global capabilities to assess and manage climate risk.
